content: just tone it by susan ashcroft yarn use 2 yarns with good contrast a self- striping or handspun yarn and a solid work well allow approx 200m/220yds of each of the 2 contrasting yarns the details are for dk weight mc but the cast-on number could be adjusted for other yarn weights needle size and gauge approx 20 sts per 10cm/4 in pattern stitch you do not need to knit to a specific gauge just be sure you like the fabric you are creating and check the size see below suggestion for average gauge spincycle dyed in the wool + dk with 4 5mm/us7 the fibre co &make dk on 4 5mm/us7 if you are a tight knitter size up you can find more yarn ideas and projects linked if you are a loose knitter size down to the pattern page on ravelry link abbreviations you can check the width after about 2 /5cm you will have to position on a 45º angle k = knit and then measure the width across as p = purl shown photo shows a just wiggle it st s = stitch es but the principle is the same k2tog = knit 2 sts together sl = slip all sts are slipped purlwise pw = purlwise wyib = with yarn in back wyif = with yarn in front kfb = knit into the front and back loops makes 1 new stitch rs/ws = right side/wrong side mc main colour the solid cc contrast colour the fancy yarn although equal amounts of each yarn will be used photo by vhglass i have called the solid the mc ashcroft 2026 for personal non-commercial use only 2 just tone it notes no need to swatch because you will use a small number of stitches you may as well just start but if you are not sure about the fabric then restart with a different needle size separately so that you can compare the two pieces and decide which to continue with making the cowl cast on using provisional cast-on i used the method whereby stitches are picked up in a crochet chain of waste yarn i used 58 sts if you want to adjust you can use any multiple of 4 +2 e g 50 sts or 62 sts if you cast on more sts you may need to allow more yarn getting a neat edge pick up the new yarn from underneath on row 3 and 7 you will need to cross yarns at the start of the row - this way the yarn will be carried neatly up the edge i have added cross at the start of the rs row as a reminder set-up row 0 with mc p3 *k3 p1 repeat from * to last 3 sts k2 p1 worked only once row 1 - cc kfb *sl1 wyib k3 repeat from * to the last 5 sts sl1 wyib k2 k2tog row 2 cc sl1 wyif p2 *sl1 wyif p3 repeat from *
